age_range.evidence: Participant's work experience (master's degree last year) and interests (playing games, TV shows)

living_situation.evidence: Participant states ‘I’m currently living with my girlfriend’

occupation.evidence: Participant describes work at a startup company as ‘researcher and content creator’

education.evidence: Participant states ‘I graduated from [ORG_MASKED] last year. I did. My master’s in game science and design bef.’

goals_and_motivations.value: Enjoying leisure time, learning new things, collecting items, getting good at games
goals_and_motivations.evidence: Quotes include: ‘I like to learn new things…’, ‘I like to collect these these small things…’, ‘I like to get good at it’

interests.evidence: Participant repeatedly mentions playing games, watching TV shows, collecting items, and using tech devices

values.evidence: Participant’s behavior around deals, research on Reddit, and preference for user reviews

frequency_of_use.evidence: Participant frequently shops on Amazon and uses Reddit for research

where_used_devices.evidence: Participant primarily uses smartphone and desktop to shop and research

search_style_best_vs_first.evidence: Participant uses the first product that appears on Amazon and frequently compares products

price_preference_cheapest_vs_expensive.evidence: Participant prioritizes finding the cheapest deals and utilizes discounts like Black Friday

decision_factors.evidence: Participant explicitly states these factors as important during their decision-making process

preferred_categories.evidence: Participant purchases controllers, phone cases, Lego, and comforters

pain_points_and_or_challenges.value: Finding reliable information, dealing with low-quality products, managing returns
pain_points_and_or_challenges.evidence: Participant’s experience with the comforter, returning items, and seeking information on Reddit
